definition: to cling to/to be reluctant to give up (sth)/to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
to feel attached to/to long for/to love

sentences.english: All are only I cling to you.
Cling to you sweet. Ten years only flashed by.
sentences.chinese: 貪戀你的甜蜜，十年不過短短的一瞬。

sentences.english: Some people believe that the desire of money cause the crimes.
sentences.chinese: 一些人認爲大多數的犯罪都是因爲對金錢的貪戀。

sentences.english: The first teaching of wisdom at the beginning of Proverbs is not to be greedy of gain.
sentences.chinese: 箴言開頭所講智慧的第一樣訓誨就是不可貪戀財利。

sentences.english: Keep off fame and wealth; crave not external attractions. Always see life as a candle flickering in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 勿涉足名利，勿貪戀外境，時刻視生命如風中之燭。

sentences.english: In addition, you also have to get rid of attachments and aversions.
sentences.chinese: 另外，你也必須清除貪戀和反感。

sentences.english: I hanker for the daytime even when I was a child.
sentences.chinese: 甚至當我只是個孩子的時候，我就貪戀着白天的時光。

sentences.english: For their foundation is built on the love of money.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他們的根基是建立在貪戀錢財上。

sentences.english: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.
sentences.chinese: 不可貪戀他的美食，因爲是哄人的食物。

sentences.english: Perhaps, I am lonely too long, only lusted after a hug.
sentences.chinese: 也許，我是孤單太久，才貪戀了一個擁抱。

sentences.english: Cling to a warm in the past, afraid of the lonely now.
sentences.chinese: 貪戀過去的一種溫暖，害怕現當下的這種寂寞。

sentences.english: We've never lusted after a cartoon character or the central figure in a computer game.
sentences.chinese: 我們從來不貪戀在卡通人物或電腦遊戲的焦點人物。

sentences.english: Some ppl consider the reason of most crimes as being greedy for money.
sentences.chinese: 一些人認爲大多數的犯罪都是因爲對金錢的貪戀。

sentences.english: Have you ever wondered why we first began lusting after diamonds?
sentences.chinese: 你是否想知道我們最初貪戀鑽石是出於什麼原因？

definition: to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
